results.title: Little mut goes flying: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising LITTLE MUT GOES FLYING, BABYSITTING FOR MRS MOLE, TIMOTHY’S PET BALLOON, THE TRAIL and THE MODEL MONSTER. LITTLE MUT GOES FLYING: The animals decide to build a see saw- motivated by a trip to the playground. Woeful decides that’s boring and sets off to Bluebell Wood to build a swing. BABYSITTING FOR MRS MOLE: Stripey and Getup babysit the baby moles whilst Mrs Mole is visiting her sick sister. They have their hands full when the babies escape from the summer house. TIMOTHY’S PET BALLOON: The animals start to worry that Timothy doesn’t love them anymore when he tells them that he’s buying a rabbit. An unexpected visitor arrives on the shelf and the animals decide to move into the rabbit hutch. THE TRAIL: The animals become interested in exploration after Timothy reads them a book about explorers. Timothy decides it would be fun if he laid a trail of his own and the animals get a chance to be explorers as they follow the clues Timothy has left them. THE MODEL MONSTER: The animals try their hand at model making after seeing Timothy make a model ship from some old pieces of cardboard and egg boxes.
results.title_for_label: Little mut goes flying: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films

results.title: Music in the woods: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising MUSIC IN THE WOODS, THE ANIMAL GARDEN, WOEFUL AND THE WASPBERRIES, TIDYING TIMOTHY’S BEDROOM and GUMPA SOLVES A JIGSAW PUZZLE. MUSIC IN THE WOODS: Timothy and the special animals spend a day in the woods collecting feathers. As a precaution against any animals getting lost, they take their musical instruments to play if they get lost in the woods. In the woods they meet a new friend, the Parrot, but they soon realise that Little Mut is missing. THE ANIMAL GARDEN: The animals are given their own garden to look after by Timothy. Nothing seems to be growing, until Woeful and Gumpa decide to help things along. WOEFUL AND THE WASPBERRIES: The animals decide to organise a surprise birthday picnic for Timothy and they are all caught up in the preparations, except for Woeful who has forgotten all about Timothy’s birthday. Luckily he has an idea for a present, but it’s an idea that will lead him into all sorts of trouble. TIDYING TIMOTHY’S BEDROOM: When Timothy gets into trouble for having a messy bedroom, the animals decide to surprise him by tidying it themselves. There’s a prize for the first one to finish up, but there are even more surprises in store, especially for Timothy. GUMPA SOLVES A JIGSAW PUZZLE: Timothy and the animals are working on a jigsaw when Timothy is called in for tea. When they resume the puzzle after dinner, they discover a piece missing and the animals must perform a bit of detective work to find the missing piece.

results.title: Stripey to the rescue: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE, GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX, THE TREASURE HUNT, GETUP CRUSOE and KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF. STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE: Timothy’s mother decides that Stripey and Getup are old and dirty and could harm Timothy who is suffering from a cold. She gives them away to a jumble sale but on the way Getup is kidnapped by the circus and meets a mouse called Kinker. GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX: Gumpa decides that he is unwell when he wakes up one morning and his head is turned around the wrong way. His friends, Timothy and Little Mut come out in sympathy. THE TREASURE HUNT: All of the toys are hunting for treasure after Gumpa finds a mysterious plan. Getup and Stripey look in a tunnel, Little Mut is helped by a squirrel and Woeful from Jick the Jackdaw. With everyone on the case, they are sure to find something. GETUP CRUSOE: The animals are listening to Timothy reading ‘Robinson Crusoe’ but the story in interrupted when Timothy has to go to school. After he has left, Stripey has an idea, Getup has an adventure and Little Mut is very brave. KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF: When Stripey and Getup visit Mr Trig’s pet shop with Timothy they find their friend Kinker stuck in a cage. With a little help from Timothy they help him escape and find a new home for him on the animal shelf; Kinker is unhappy however, he wants to go back to his real home.

results.title: Casino royale
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Joseph McGrath, Ken Hughes, Robert Parrish, Val Guest, Charles K. Feldman, Jerry Bresler and Famous Artists Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The greatest spy in history, Sir James Bond, has long since retired. The stuttering super spy now content with his garden and afternoons of classical music. His legend has lived on with his namesakes populating the continent, only of late, 11 of them have disappeared under dubious circumstances. Sir James (David Niven) is reluctantly brought out of retirement after the demise of M (John Huston) and faces fierce opposition in the form of an army of beautiful women but manages to make it back to MI5. Once there, he implements an anti-female spy device but he too is captured by SMERSH. A further measure includes naming all spies, including the girls, James Bond 007, to throw the opposition off the scent. Bond blackmails the beautiful Vesper Lynd (Bond regular Ursula Andress) to use her feminine wiles on Baccarat champion Evelyn Tremble (Peter Sellers) to defeat Le Chiffre (Orson Welles) who is bankrolling the activities of SMERSH. Notable cameos include Woody Allen as Jimmy Bond, James’ neurotic nephew lost in the Caribbean and Deborah Kerr as French spy Mimi. Whilst based on an Ian Fleming novel, “Casino royale” was the only Bond novel not sold to Eon Productions and it was deemed that the only film to rival a true Bond film was a parody. The effect was met with mixed reviews and the film does suffer from having five directors at the helm. However, scenes involving Peter Sellers are particularly entertaining. Soundtrack by Burt Bacharach.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Huston, Joseph McGrath, Ken Hughes, Robert Parrish, Val Guest, Charles K. Feldman, Jerry Bresler and Famous Artists Productions

results.title: A View to a kill (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Albert R. Broccoli, Michael G. Wilson and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
With a pre-title sequence involving impressive Arctic down hill skiing cum snowboarding (complete with a Beach Boys track), “A View to a kill” marks the final appearance of Roger Moore as Secret Agent 007. When the body of 003 is found concealed beneath the ice, he has in his possession a precious microchip - one impervious to the magnetic force of a nuclear explosion. What’s special about the chip however is that the KGB chip is a perfect replica of one designed in the West by Zorin Industries; someone has been leaking secrets to the Soviets. Head of the industry is Frenchman Max Zorin (a fiendish Christopher Walken who revels in his villainous persona), ably assisted by his right hand “man” May Day (Grace Jones). Zorin’s plan is to take a stranglehold of the International microchip cartel by ridding himself of rival manufacturers - mainly contained within California’s Silicone Valley - thanks to a series of strategically placed explosions along the San Andreas Fault. James goes after Zorin in a trans-continental journey from England to France then America where the film climaxes in a blimp over the Golden Gate Bridge. Notable action sequences include an Eiffel Tower chase, a deadly car wash, a competitive steeplechase and a fiery elevator and fire engine. Tanya Roberts stars as Bond girl seismologist Stacey Sutton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Glen, Albert R. Broccoli, Michael G. Wilson and Danjaq

Zorin’s plan is to take a stranglehold of the International microchip cartel by ridding himself of rival manufacturers - mainly contained within California’s Silicone Valley - thanks to a series of strategically placed explosions along the San Andreas Fault. James goes after Zorin in a trans-continental journey from England to France then America where the film climaxes in a blimp over the Golden Gate Bridge. Notable action sequences include an Eiffel Tower chase, a deadly car wash, a competitive steeplechase and a fiery elevator and fire engine. Tanya Roberts stars as Bond girl seismologist Stacey Sutton.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
With a pre-title sequence involving impressive Arctic down hill skiing cum snowboarding (complete with a Beach Boys track), “A View to a kill” marks the final appearance of Roger Moore as Secret Agent 007. When the body of 003 is found concealed beneath the ice, he has in his possession a precious microchip - one impervious to the magnetic force of a nuclear explosion. What’s special about the chip however is that the KGB chip is a perfect replica of one designed in the West by Zorin Industries; someone has been leaking secrets to the Soviets. Head of the industry is Frenchman Max Zorin (a fiendish Christopher Walken who revels in his villainous persona), ably assisted by his right hand “man” May Day (Grace Jones). Zorin’s plan is to take a stranglehold of the International microchip cartel by ridding himself of rival manufacturers - mainly contained within California’s Silicone Valley - thanks to a series of strategically placed explosions along the San Andreas Fault. James goes after Zorin in a trans-continental journey from England to France then America where the film climaxes in a blimp over the Golden Gate Bridge. Notable action sequences include an Eiffel Tower chase, a deadly car wash, a competitive steeplechase and a fiery elevator and fire engine. Tanya Roberts stars as Bond girl seismologist Stacey Sutton.

results.title: On Her Majesty's secret service
results.creator_credit: Peter Hunt, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Bond is approached by a crime boss to marry his widowed daughter, Tracy, after hearing of the good deeds that Bond has demonstrated in saving his suicidal child. The father offers one million pounds, Bond asks for the location of Ernst Blofeld (Telly Savalas), head of SPECTRE in return. Disguised as a (kilted) genealogist with the College of Arms, Bond travels to Blofeld’s Alpine residence to discuss investigation into whether Blofeld is a legitimate count. Once there, Bond stumbles across a bizarre scene in which he dines with a room containing a bevy of beautiful women eating only one type of food. This is part of their treatment at Blofeld’s allergy treatment clinic that also includes late night brain-washing. The clinic is a sinister front - Blofeld is planning a bacteriological war. Features a car rally on ice with Diana Rigg in the driver’s seat, and plenty of down hill skiing and other snow-related action. In a departure from most Bond films, Bond (George Lazenby in his only performance as 007) actually falls for the girl, confessing his love and proposing, surviving a brief but ultimately tragic marriage.

results.title: Octopussy (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Albert R. Broccoli and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Starting with an impressive sequence involving a small plane and a closing hangar, “Octopussy” also crosses the countries of East Berlin and Delhi and culminates in a train sequence then a big top. When an agent is found dead in East Berlin clutching a Faberge egg, British intelligence is alerted to the flurry of fake Faberges on the market from an unknown source - possibly Russian (alarm bells ring). The mission is code-named Operation Treasure Trove; Secret agent 007 (Roger Moore) placed in charge of proceedings. His mission takes him to Delhi in pursuit of exiled Indian Prince Kamal Khan (Louis Jordan), suspected owner of the Faberge eggs. He is not the top of the chain however, that honour lies with the mysterious Octopussy (Maud Adams), head of a floating harem of acrobatic women who have joined her sisterhood as a way of life, and agreed to taking part in smuggling jewellery and the circus Octopussy is running. Highlights include a snake charming agent, a hair raising tuk tuk ride, a jungle chase complete with elephants, tigers, snakes and a leech, death by circular saw, and the sight of Roger Moore in a clown suit.

results.title: The World is not enough (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Barbara Broccoli, Michael G. Wilson, Danjaq and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Featuring the longest pre credit sequence in the Bond franchise, “The World is not enough” has more than one fiendish villain and a start including a knife throwing sniper, a brief interlude, then an extended powerboat chase on the Thames followed by a hot air balloon. British oil tycoon Sir Robert King is killed via a booby trap at MI6 by a terrorist, thought to be Renard the Anarchist (Robert Carlyle) - an ex KGB agent whose only goal is to create chaos. His claim to fame is a bullet permanently lodged in his head, killing off his senses as well as any feeling of pain, effectively making him super-human. Renard was also responsible for the kidnapping of King’s daughter Elektra (Sophie Marceau) and Bond is sent to protect her and to find the traitor on staff. A ploy is uncovered to steal an atomic missile and use it for sabotage. Nuclear scientist Dr Christmas Jones (Denise Richards) assists Bond is the retrieval process, as well as providing Bond with another potential conquest. Notorious for being the last film in which Q (Desmond Llewelyn) appears, we also see a more humanised M (Judi Dench) and a dazzling array of inventive chase sequences.

results.title: For your eyes only (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Albert R. Broccoli and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
When a British electronic surveillance submarine goes missing in the Ionian Sea, alarm bells sound due to the precious cargo that has also disappeared; ATAC, automatic targeting attack communicator - in the wrong hands it could bring the entire naval system to its knees. Code named Operation Undertow, Bond (Roger Moore) is sent to interview the only witness to the murder of a Greek marine archaeologist enlisted to help in the retrieval of the vessel, a beautiful brunette archer called Melina (Carol Boquet). Featuring high on the list of suspects are enemies Aristotle Kristasos (Julian Glover) and Columbo/The Dove (Topol), both of whom would want to locate ATAC. Highlights include Bond partaking in impressive down hill skiing with an impressionable and doe eyed young skater (professional ice skater Lynn-Holly Johnson), a vicious ice hockey practice, being dragged behind a boat as shark bait, and receiving a complimentary call from a faux Margaret Thatcher. Opening with Bond by the graveside of his wife then a passenger in Blofeld’s Remote Control airways, the film moves from one action packed stunt to the next and culminates in a cliff top assault. It is also the first Bond film to be based on one of Ian Fleming’s short stories rather than on a novel.
